message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of phase recovery, which is a common problem in signal processing and communication systems. The paper proposes a Bayesian approach to solve this problem, which involves the use of variational methods to minimize the Kullback-Leibler divergence. This approach is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), numerical analysis (cs.NA), and signal processing (cs.SI). Among these sub-categories, cs.IT and cs.LG are the most likely, as the paper deals with statistical inference and optimization, which are core topics in these fields.
